title: American_Top_40_1980_May_17th
description:
"As we continue the countdown of the forty biggest hits in the USA I'd like to welcome KZZQ in Golden Meadow, Louisiana to the American Top 40 family, great to have you with us. My name is Casey Kasem and we're doing our weekly survey of the most popular records in the country as computed by Billboard Magazine, and on we go."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

There is a song in the countdown where possession of the record (in fact, the entire album) was a crime in South Africa in May of 1980. Casey tells the story.

Casey answers the question, "What song holds the record for most weeks in the top ten without ever hitting number one?" Casey says 17 weeks.

The first father/daughter duet of the rock era is in the countdown.

A listener wants to know, "Have any songs about God ever made it big on the pop chart?" Casey says 6 songs about God have made the top five, and one of those was by a Catholic Nun. Then there is one more detail that Casey says, "... must just be a coincidence."

Blondie has the first hit of the 80's to spend more than four weeks at number one.

Finally, a  listener wants to know, "What album in the rock era has taken the most weeks to hit number one on the LP chart?" Casey says the average album takes 7 weeks to hit number one, but this one took 58 weeks to get there, and it included the hit song, "Rhiannon."

LW#3: Lost In Love - Air Supply
LW#2: Ride Like The Wind - Christopher Cross
LW#1: Call Me - Blondie
